Grip.comm: Comfortable grip with effective shock reduction.

cont.entity_a: Feels off compared to previous models.
Curved white hickory handle fits comfortably in hand. Long handle provides extended reach. Thick handle is a downside.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable and the length is just right for reach. Durable and comfortable handle.

Magnet.comm: Magnetic nail holder helps with nail starting.

cont.entity_a: The magnetic nail starter on the blue version is worth the extra money.
cont.entity_b: Magnetic nail starter not included in this model.

cont.entity_a: Great weight for driving framing nails. Does not make elbow ache due to weight.
cont.entity_b: The hammer is not the heaviest. Heavier weight adds strength when hitting nails.
Anti-vibe feature reduces wrist pain. Anti-vibe feature helps eliminate stress on joints.

cont.entity_a: The head is quick cranked out of a machine with sharp edges, not hand polished.
cont.entity_b: Nice design and comfortable to hold.

cont.entity_a: Wood on head wears over time but lasts well.
Great price, not worried about the wood handle possibly breaking.
The claw has very good bite, making it easy to pull out nails.
Great for framing and general/demo work. Great for house framing.
cont.entity_b: Good for a range of tasks. Good for carpentry work.

cont.entity_a: Nice fit/finish. The lacquer finish can be scuffed up for a non-slip surface.
Feels like made in China low quality despite being labeled as made in USA.
